channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-15864] Job submitter / executor fail when SBN domain name can not resolved
item.description:
Job submit failure and Task executes failure if Standby NameNode domain name can not resolved on HDFS HA with DelegationToken feature.

This issue is triggered when create ConfiguredFailoverProxyProvider instance which invoke HAUtil.cloneDelegationTokenForLogicalUri in HA mode with Security. Since in HDFS HA mode UGI need include separate token for each NameNode in order to dealing with Active-Standby switch, the double tokens' content is same of course.
However when #setTokenService in HAUtil.cloneDelegationTokenForLogicalUri it checks whether the address of NameNode has been resolved or not, if Not, throw #IllegalArgumentException upon, then job submitter/ task executor fail.

HDFS-8068 and HADOOP-12125 try to fix it, but I don't think the two tickets resolve completely.
Another questions many guys consider is why NameNode domain name can not resolve? I think there are many scenarios, for instance node replace when meet fault, and refresh DNS sometimes. Anyway, Standby NameNode failure should not impact Hadoop cluster stability in my opinion.

a. code ref: org.apache.hadoop.security.SecurityUtil line373-386

  public static Text buildTokenService(InetSocketAddress addr) {
    String host = null;
    if (useIpForTokenService) {
      if (addr.isUnresolved()) { // host has no ip address
        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
            new UnknownHostException(addr.getHostName())
        );
      }
      host = addr.getAddress().getHostAddress();
    } else {
      host = StringUtils.toLowerCase(addr.getHostName());
    }
    return new Text(host + ":" + addr.getPort());
  }

b.exception log ref:

item.summary: Job submitter / executor fail when SBN domain name can not resolved

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: submit initial patch based branch-2.7, not throw exception and postpone failure if token do not update since domain name can not resolved.

hi weichiu, would you mind giving it a look? Thanks.

Thanks hexiaoqiao it does look like a problem to fix.

Some general comments:

  1. the method SecurityUtil#setTokenService is used indirectly to acquire several kinds of delegation tokens, including HDFS DT, KMS DT as well as YARN Timeline DT. So don't assume the "addr" is a NameNode.
  2. In the case of KMS DT, clients goes to each of KMS in a round-robin fashion. If the host name can't be resolved, it may fail KMS operations. I am hoping the warning message can be more generic and more alarming. Like "unable to resolve host name xxx. Failure to construct a correct token service name may result in operation failures"
  3. test please?
Thanks weichiu for your quick response. HADOOP-15864-branch.2.7.002.patch update with more general warn message and add new unit test. FYI.
submit HADOOP-15864.003.patch for branch trunk.

-1 overall

weichiu check fail unit test and it passed at local machine, I think it is not related about this patch. another question, HADOOP-15864-branch.2.7.002.patch is for branch-2.7 , however jenkins apply it to branch-3.3.0, could you give some suggestions?

Thanks for the patch. 

First off, please update the affect versions and fix versions.

It sounds to me the bug still exists in trunk, so you should definitely provide a patch against trunk to begin with.

If you do intend to offer a patch for branch-2.7, try to rename the patch as HADOOP-15864.branch.2.7.002.patch. I find separately the jira ID, branch name and revision numbers by dots works for me all the time.
Thanks weichiu for your suggestion, HADOOP-15864.003.patch is ready for branch trunk, and I fond unit test has pass. I also rename v002 follow the right format and resubmit. FYI.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #15323 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/15323/)
HADOOP-15864. Job submitter / executor fail when SBN domain name can not (weichiu: rev fb2b72e6fce019130e10964a644b94cddbab1c06)

  • (edit) hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/namenode/ha/TestDelegationTokensWithHA.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/SecurityUtil.java

check fail unit test and it passed at local machine, I think it is not related about this patch

hexiaoqiao weichiu mind giving a check again to hadoop.hdfs.web.TestWebHdfsFileSystemContract

Thanks weichiu for your review.

He Xiaoqiao Wei-Chiu Chuang mind giving a check again to hadoop.hdfs.web.TestWebHdfsFileSystemContract

Thanks for your feedback, I will recheck this UT in next two day.

Thanks ayushtkn feedback, I recheck the fail UT (#TestWebHdfsFileSystemContract) and retest at local machine, it is related to the issue.
The main reason:
Before patch, WebHdfsHandler at DataNode will meet IllegalArgumentException at SecurityUtil#buildTokenService when create DFSClient instance using newDfsClient(nnId, confForCreate); when handle event onCreate but client do not pass parameter #namenoderpcaddress, so Client will meet HTTP status code 400.
After patch, DataNode will NOT meet IllegalArgumentException when create DFSClient instance, however, when DataNode creates wrapped outputstream, it will meet auth exception since no token exist, so Client will meet HTTP status code 403.
In one word, this patch changes http semantic when no parameter about #namenoderpcaddress.
I have created another ticket HADOOP-15883 to trace this issue.
Thanks ayushtkn again and sorry I do not see it in time when check fail ut in my local environment.

hexiaoqiao there is big side effect outside HDFS also which is causing other junit tests to fail in YARN. I looked a bit further into this change to find a number of other callers of SecurityUtil.buildTokenService in YARN and MAPREDUCE and none seem to handle a null response value. All calls do a toString on the returned value without a null check causing a NPE.

I think we need to reconsider the null return value.
Sounds like we should revert this change and start over?
Reopen it. Let's revert the change for now to unblock the failing tests, and it sounds like we should reconsider the logic changed here, rather than patching here and there.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #15331 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/15331/)
Revert "HADOOP-15864. Job submitter / executor fail when SBN domain name (weichiu: rev 63e7134df6c4521e973707edcf99746e4f72f03d)

a number of other callers of SecurityUtil.buildTokenService in YARN and MAPREDUCE and none seem to handle a null response value

OMG, I will try to fix this issue and keep compatibility with YARN and other assembly in the next days.
Thanks weichiu,wilfreds again.
upload new patch HADOOP-15864.004.patch and I try to fix this issue with new configuration in order to avoid this fix affect other unit test.
re-upload patch HADOOP-15864.005.patch (same as last one) and just for trigger Jenkins.
